description:
Freshwater is a high quality canyon with a long sustained canyon section. 15 km long and 525 metre ascent. Wet suit is advisable.

This canyon is also described in limited detail in Canyons Near Sydney by Rick Jamieson. Help the Australian canyoning community by contributing track notes to ropewiki.com

Approach

Follow the fire trail along Capertee river for about 2 km. At -33.13792, 150.33201 head up the ridge to the cliff line. Follow the cliff line to the left till you reach a big cave at -33.14512, 150.32350 This is a good camp cave. Cross the river and head up a crack in the cliff line at -33.14498, 150.32275. Walk along the ridge till the start of the canyon.

Descent

  • R1:12m RR from tree.
  • R2:13m RR from tree.
  • R3: 4m RR from tree.
  • R4: 5m from log.
  • R5: 4m from a sling on a rock.

Exit

When you reach the cave either walk back the way you walked in or continue down the river to the fire trail.

Red tape

Background
name: Freshwater Creek
